page.title: 19Park Farm,Bedford.
page.content: The farm has 1200 acres.This is split up into two areas-700 acres just north of Bedford and the other 500 acres at Kempston.The area north of Bedford consists of 4 fields of cereals,4 fields of 'break' crops and 4 fields of rough pasture.1 field of grass is used for making hay.Cows kept on the farm are Friesians and Herefords.The Herefords are fattened up and killed for beef;the Friesians give milk for use in dairy products.There are 9 male workers.The oldest man is 62 years old and the youngest is 19.3 of the workers live on the farm,1 lives in Clapham,2 in Bedford and 1 in Renhold.During the winter they work from 0730 to 1600.In the summer work is from 0730 to 1700hrs.The oldest man worked on the farm for 48 years.
